title: Recognizing balanceable matrices
abstract:
A 0/ ± 1 matrix is balanced if it does not contain a square submatrix with exactly two nonzero\ud
entries per row and per column in which the sum of all entries is 2 modulo 4. A 0/1 matrix is balanceable\ud
if its nonzero entries can be signed ±1 so that the resulting matrix is balanced. A signing algorithm due to\ud
Camion shows that the problems of recognizing balanced 0/ ± 1 matrices and balanceable 0/1 matrices are\ud
equivalent. Conforti, Cornu´ejols, Kapoor andVuˇskovi´c gave an algorithm to test if a 0/±1 matrix is balanced.\ud
Truemper has characterized balanceable 0/1 matrices in terms of forbidden submatrices. In this paper we give\ud
an algorithm that explicitly finds one of these forbidden submatrices or shows that none exists
